intro: Palicourea zakii, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many plants with medicinal properties. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale green, while its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule. Palicourea zakii is of interest in botanical research due to its potential pharmacological applications.
